title: Is an associates degree considered an undergraduate degree or is that only when you get a 4-year degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question/that’s a. An associate degree is an “undergraduate” degree, as in it’s not a graduate degree. Assuming the term “graduate degree” means a degree earned after a bachelors degree. So a person with an associates degree could say they had an undergraduate degree, and not be wrong. However, it would be better, when discussing college degrees to someone such as a prospective employer who might check the veracity of the claim, to identify an associates degree by that name and not an say it is an “undergraduate” degree.
Graduate school usually begins at the master’s degree level. Anything under that is usually considered an undergraduate degree, including an associate degree.
